vision.notes: Large eyes suggest good vision, especially adapted for nocturnal activity. Likely used for prey detection and navigation in low light conditions.

mechanoreception.notes: Fish possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water. This is inferred and very important for spatial awareness, predator avoidance and prey detection.

chemoreception.notes: Fish possess taste and olfactory receptors. These senses are very important for food detection.
